definition: to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to hinder/to obstruct/to block
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to hinder/to obstruct/to block
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: Children get in the way during in the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在假日里总是碍手碍脚的。

sentences.english: I don't want you kids under my feet while I'm cooking.
sentences.chinese: 我做饭时不希望你们这些孩子在我这儿碍手碍脚的。

sentences.english: On the other hand, conductors often aren't inspiring and just get in the way.
sentences.chinese: 此外，指挥们往往非但不能鼓舞人心，反而碍手碍脚。

sentences.english: I'm really busy – stop getting in the way.
sentences.chinese: 我正忙着呢，别在这里碍手碍脚的。

sentences.english: Although he meant to help us prepare the dinner, he was only in the way.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他是想帮助我们准备晚餐，但他只是碍手碍脚。

sentences.english: Put this in the other room so as to keep it out of the way.
sentences.chinese: 把这东西放到另一间屋里去，免得它在这里碍手碍脚。

sentences.english: I'll stand this box in the corner; it will be out of the way there.
sentences.chinese: 我将把这个箱子竖放在角落里，它就不会碍手碍脚了。

definition: (usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
to be officious/to kibitz/to be meddlesome/to force one's help upon
unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2

definition: to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
clumsy/all thumbs
to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
to be a drag or hindrance on sb
to shy away from work/to get by without attending duty
to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
